User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; nl; rv:1.9.2.23) Gecko/20110921 Ubuntu/10.04 (lucid) Firefox/3.6.23
Build ID: 20110921065534

Steps to reproduce:

Setting up a lockpref "mail.server.server2.offline_download" should set the "keep messages [...] on this computer" setting in Account Settings - Synchronisation and Storage locked to "false", i.e. it should not be possible to click it.

Note that it's still possible to use the "Advanced" button, which is (as I understand) by design, see bug #537943.


Actual results:

However, with the lockpref active, it is possible to click "keep messages on this computer". This does not really change the setting itself, which is locked - so that part works.

There is, however, a nasty side effect: all of the acount's folders are immediately selected for "offline use"; which is, in fact, the same as selecting "Keep messages ... on this computer".


Expected results:

The lockpref should grey out the "Keep Messages [...] on this computer", to show that this preference is locked.

comments.text:
Bug 282541 is non-related, as it merely handles how to set lockprefs correctly.

This bug is about the side-effect of setting the offline_download-lock. While the locking is in place, Thunderbird's UI behaves like the offline_download lock functions, but in the background, it does the opposite and marks everything as offline_download-ready.
